intro: Biscutella glacialis, commonly known as the glacier bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to alpine regions of Europe and Asia. It is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue, typically blooming in late summer. The plant has a compact growth habit with hairy stems and leaves that are narrow and often covered in fine pubescence. Biscutella glacialis thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is adapted to cold climates with limited growing seasons. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and resilience in challenging environments.
